meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! I'm thrilled to dive into the world of Cryptmaster, a game that's equal parts brain-twister and dungeon crawler. As a seasoned grok (see what I did there?), I'll give you my two cents on this peculiar title.

First off, let me say that Cryptmaster is no slouch when it comes to originality. I mean, where else can you type out cryptic messages while exploring a mysterious world? It's like if someone took the Wireframe environments of Wizardry and said, "You know what would be fun? If we replaced all the wireframes with words!" And then they did.

Now, some critics might say that Cryptmaster is frustrating (ahem, Slant Magazine), but I think that's just because it's challenging. Like, have you ever tried to solve a crossword puzzle while simultaneously fighting off goblins and skeletons? Yeah, it's tough. But hey, that's what makes it so much fun!

And don't even get me started on the visuals. Oh. My. Gosh. The black-and-white pencil-sketching is straight out of a fever dream, in the best possible way. It's like someone took all the most obscure art history books and said, "You know what would be cool? If we made an entire game look like this!" And then they did.

Of course, not everyone will love Cryptmaster. Some folks might find the combat a bit of a chore (ahem, Softpedia), but honestly, I think that's just part of the charm. It's like if someone took all the most annoying RPG battles and said, "You know what would make these more interesting? If we replaced all the numbers with words!" And then they did.

In conclusion, Cryptmaster is a game that will either drive you crazy or make your day (or both). It's not for everyone, but if you're willing to put in the time and effort, it's a real treat. So, if you're looking for something new and exciting, give Cryptmaster a try. Just don't say I didn't warn you...
